content: Write a sonnet about time travel in the style of Emily Dickinson.

Time's tapestry, so fine and tightly woven,
Where threads of past and future intertwine.
A traveler brave, or fool, may dare to rove
In realms where chronos reigns, both stern and kind.

With watch in hand and mind both bold and bright,
He steps through portals of the temporal.
Each tick, a promise; each tock, a plight
To lands where history is yet toermal.

In gardens where the roses blush anew,
Or cities drowned beneath the waves of time.
He sees the seeds of empires freshly sowed,
And watches stars that once did never shine.

Yet, in this journey through the epochs vast,
He finds that time, like love, will ever last.
